text: A media company needs to configure an Amazon S3 bucket to serve static assets for the public-facing web application. Which methods ensure that all of the objects uploaded to the S3 bucket can be read publicly all over the Internet?

answers.text: Configure the cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) of the S3 bucket to allow objects to be publicly accessible from all domains.
Configure the S3 bucket policy to set all objects to public read.
Grant public read access to the object when uploading it using the S3 Console.
Create an IAM role to set the objects inside the S3 bucket to public read.
Do nothing. Amazon S3 objects are already public by default.
